contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses}} {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} [[Image:Cerisier du Japon Prunus serrulata.jpg|right|thumb|230px|Cherry blossoms in full bloom]] {{Wiktionarypar|blossom}} In [[botany]], '''blossom''' is a term given to the [[flowers]] of [[stone fruit]] [[fruit tree|trees]] (genus ''[[Prunus]]'') and of some other plants with a similar appearance that flower profusely for a period of time in [[spring (season)|spring]]. Colloquially flowers of [[orange (fruit)|orange]] are referred to as such as well. Blossoms are either pink or white depending on the species or variety. [[Peach]] (including nectarine) blossoms, most [[cherry]] blossoms, and some [[almond]] blossoms are usually pink. [[Plum]] blossoms, [[apple]] blossoms, orange blossoms, some [[cherry]] blossoms, and most [[almond]] blossoms are white. Blossoms provide [[pollen]] to [[pollinator]]s such as bees, and initiate cross-pollination necessary for the trees to reproduce by producing fruit. Blossom trees have a tendency to lose their flower [[petal]]s in wind-blown cascades, often covering the surrounding ground in petals. This attribute tends to distinguish ''blossom'' trees from other flowering trees. ==Gallery== <gallery> Image:Apple_Tree_in_Full_Bloom.JPG|Apple blossoms in full bloom.
